headline: Rolling Storms
description: A dream-poem where storms carry the speaker through memory, denial, and ultimately toward light. It holds the tension of repetition and endurance, yet resolves with forward momentum and divine illumination.
author: Aleksandr
whyItMatters: This poem marks a liminal point between Echo Moon and Ash Moon Ascending: the storms embody bewildered repetition, yet the invocation of God’s light and the final plea to be carried forward signal movement toward dawn. It records faith’s endurance through storm and the transformation of backward-carrying memory into forward-driven hope.

motifMap.meaning: Turmoil, cycles of memory, divine trial

articleExcerpt:
Dreams
rolling storms
carry me back.

Walking through memory,
thrice the old path, denied.

God,
light shines!

Dreams
rolling storms,
carry me forward.
